data.chText: 极地的；近地极的；南极（或北极）的
data.enText: connected with, or near the North or South Pole
connected with the poles (= the positive and negative ends) of a magnet

data.chText: 完全相反的；截然对立的
data.enText: used to describe sth that is the complete opposite of sth else

data.chText: 父母的观点常与孩子的完全相反。
data.enText: The parents' position is often the polar opposite of the child's.

tr: having a pair of equal and opposite charges

example: Its pivotal location has also exposed it to periodic invasions"- Henry Kissinge
the polar events of this study
gelid waters of the North Atlantic
in diametric contradiction to his claims

tr: of or existing at or near a geographical pole or within the Arctic or Antarctic Circles
located at or near or coming from the earth's poles
example: Antarctica is the only polar continent

value.def: Polar means near the North and South Poles.

example.ex: ...the rigours of life in the polar regions...
example.tran: 在极地地区生活的艰苦

example.ex: Warmth melted some of the polar ice.
example.tran: 温暖的天气融化了一些极地的冰雪。

value.def: Polar is used to describe things which are completely opposite in character, quality, or type.

example.ex: In many ways, Brett and Bernard are polar opposites.
example.tran: 在许多方面，布雷特和伯纳德截然不同。

example.ex: ...economists at polar ends of the politico-economic spectrum.
example.tran: 政治经济观点完全对立的经济学家

value.tran: （在性质、类型等方面）完全相反的，截然对立的

trans: 极地冰；极地冰格；北极熊冰格；极地冰冻；地极的冰
摇粒绒；双面绒；双面绒布；抓毛绒；抓毛布
极性基团；极性基；極性基
极卡；极冠；极帽；极顶风；南极极冠
